intro: Hieracium lonchophyllum, commonly known as the long-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, elongated leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium lonchophyllum is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
